website_summaries.verdict: The type of gaming power supply to choose when you want more accent and flair from the component.
pros: Modular design simplifies the cable management and usage inside the computer
Comes with a customizable LED light for different lighting designs and accents
cons: Power supply is susceptible to boot loops, preventing the computer from reaching the operating system

customer_reviews.title: This will kill your system!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously read the other reviews on this product. It will fail and when it does it will murder everything in your PC. Tonight I was watching a YouTube video when my PC just turned off, when it turned back on the PSU made a very loud pop and proceeded to fry my 9700k and 2080ti rig. I know the product looks good and is “platinum” rated but pickup an Evga or Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin King

customer_reviews.title: system fried back after buying this. basically put a power spike to everything, fried all that was connected
customer_reviews.text: Ended up having to use an old power supply after this one fried parts of my gaming system. it took out my liquid cooler that took a long ass time to build.I liked you guys a lot. I even inquired about a sponsorship even after everything frying. Lost cpu, ram, gpu and 9 of my fans. Im disabled and constantly medicated, these things make it hard to recover. So I am back to a normal pc. I don't have the money or anything actually to get back to where I was. took forever to learn how to do the pipe bending and pump work. I just cant afford you guys again.
customer_reviews.author: Grim

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that this is only the second power supply I have experience with. But I got this for 4 reasons. The first is output, 2nd price, 3rd RGB and 4th is my case and all my fans are thermaltake so I've grown accustom to and trust the brand. It's packaged very nice and neat and has a very nice canvas style bag for all the cords. The instructions are simple and easy to understand. The appearance of the unit is very clean and high quality, and looks even better with the lights on. So far it has held up fine and I've been running it constantly since I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hogan

customer_reviews.title: DOA...
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 0 stars if possible. First one I ordered apparently didn't work. I confirmed this after testing with an old PSU I had laying around. They just sent me a replacement and I'm having the same issue with it. It's almost like the CPU doesn't have any power going to it. I tried with the CPU power cable and the cable coming from with atx connector, but no success. Everything is snugged.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: It does not work even with UPS.
customer_reviews.text: I used this PSU for my AMD 3950 + ASU 1080 machine. I noticed that when the machine shut down immediately when power outage occurs. So I did the following: 1. I upgrade my UPS to a APC BX1000M. Then I unplug the power cord at the wall outlet to test. The PC shuts down immediately. This behavior remained after adjusting the UPS' sensitivity to the highest. 2. Checked the internet. I found that this PSU may need sine wave UPS to work. So I bought a APC 1350MS. It still does not work. I emailed the tech support, waiting for its reply.
customer_reviews.author: VAFan

customer_reviews.title: Wrecked whole system do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product because of decent rating and had what I wanted. Since buying this it has fried over 1300$ dollars in computer parts (Ram,2 ssds, mobo, cpu, gpu). Upon further investigation this is a common problem for the manufacturer. Customer service has been horrible and it has been over 2 weeks on a reply for an insurance claim. If they do not replace the parts their components destroyed I will be contacting the better business bureau. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Mounting holes are wrong
customer_reviews.text: This power supply is meant to be installed with the fan toward the inside of the case. The mounting screw holes are made to where they only line up if the fan is mounted facing outwards. there is no way outside of a major case mod to fix this. These mounting holes are universal, so why was this power supply designed wrong? I feel cheated as this thing was not delivered as or when promised and now with 3 fewer days to complete my build, it doesn't fit as it should. I will probably return it. How Dumb?
customer_reviews.author: Doughoist

customer_reviews.title: dont buy get evga or corsair
customer_reviews.text: terrible the fan is so loud under gaming you wont belive it !!! not only that it speeds up and down i am sitting here llistening to it just makes me pissed off says rated for 750w? cant even handle this new 3rd gen ryzen 3900x on 30% load oh and graphics? its just an 2080 i just purchased evga as we speak
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: My old PSU started dying and emitting noxious fumes. Thermaltake Toughpower Grand RGB came to save the day! Thus far it has worked flawlessly right out of the box. As of this writing around 2% of reviewers have complained about it failing and ruining their systems. I will, of course, update this review should such a fate befall me. I LOVE THE SMART FAN FEATURE!!! It keeps noise and dust levels low and improves longevity of the fan and the system. Given my current power demands the fan is off almost all the time during everyday use. The fan only begins to spin when I'm taxing absolutely every aspect of my system.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Works but makes weird noise
customer_reviews.text: The powersupply works fine and boots up the computer just fine, but it makes an audible elictrical noise constantly. I did not have this noise when I had my EVGA 500B in, so I know it must be the powersupply. The noise isn't too annoying, but I just wish it wasn't there at all. I have smart fan on and it makes the noise no matter if it is on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Klanke

customer_reviews.title: Good looks for a solid PSU. Very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Thermaltake PSUs have always been reliable for me and this one is no exception. Plenty of watts for my i5 9600k with ring flow AIO, 5 case fans, GTX 1060, 32 gb rgb ram, 3 HDDs 1 SDD and a m.2 nvme. Even though my MSI board controls the argb with mystic light, the PSU compliments the scheme I a subtle way. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chadj

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Effective
customer_reviews.text: What a well priced and feature full PSU. For $100 you get so much for so little. The PSU’s fan almost never turns on and when it does it’s inaudible. The RGB fan for me is quite pointless for my case but is a nice touch. 750W is plenty for most builds these days. The fully modular design cuts down on cable traffic. Overall it’s probably the best priced PSU on amazon for what you get, my only downside is that it is quiet heavy and makes my micro ATX case ever so slightly less portable but who cares ?!. Highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Jalen fetter

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this PSU to work for me so bad it would just topped off my new build that I am working on but it showed up Dead. I should of listened to the reviews. I didn't want to chance it a second time it could end up damaging what I worked so hard for so I did what I should of done the first time, I bought Evga very dependable. Don't get me wrong Amazon treated me good and gave me a refund right away
customer_reviews.author: PBrady

customer_reviews.title: More power than a Sith lord
customer_reviews.text: Running an ASUS 570 board with a Ryzen 5 processor and 6x120mm fans. Power supply is whisper quiet. Comes with a bag full of all the connectors you would ever need for multiple video cards, tons of drives, fan connectors, even Molex 4 for those of you who haven't ditched your optical drives yet. If you don't think the money is worth it for a fully-modular PSU, you are wrong. Only attach the cables you need. Put the rest in a bag for later, or give them away as Christmas presents. Bottom line--tons of power, uncompromising selection of ports and cables, and a handy bag to keep the unused cables neat and available. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: RobotSpider

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Theraltake Toughpower Grand RGB 650W RGB power supply and it's dead right out of the box. Won't power up. Reached out to Thermaltake, zero response from them. Sending back for the Corsair RMi 750W power supply. Product looks great but apparently QC isn't their strong suit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cool for 4K video editing machine
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power if you're building a 4K video editing machine. RGB is nice, but if you are installing this with the fan facing down to intake from the underside of the case, the RGB will not be appreciated at all as it just creates an very mild underglow for the case. If that's your configuration, just get a non-RGB version of this power supply. I also like the modularity. Comes with tons of cables. Got this primarily for the 80+ Gold rating, and I have run 100% all-threads Ryzen 9 3900X CPU + 100% GTX 1660Ti GPU for several hours folding for Folding@home, and this PSU didn't even care. Great power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Slartibart Jones

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this power supply into my new pc about a month ago. Everything was great until 2 weeks ago, when my computer started randomly rebooting. It never lasted 5 minutes without restarting. Not once. I troubleshot all other hardware and software components before turning my attention to the PSU. The first thing I did was test the voltage with my multimeter. Lo and behold, the voltage was too low. So basically, it's garbage. This is a prime example of fashion over function; and why I'll never buy another Thermaltake product. You shouldn't either, for your wallet's sake!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this Model #TPG-850AH3FSGR
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this Model #TPG-850AH3FSGR This is my 3rd build and this power supply is junk. Wires are horrible. I bought this due to price instead of going with EVGA power supply like my last two builds. These wires are really bad and will make your build look horrible. Very stiff wiring. The stiffness of the included wiring will not allow you to have a clean build at all and don't even think about using these in anything less than a good size mid tower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Item was defective on arrival. Would not provide power to the CPU or GPU.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bright colored lights
customer_reviews.text: I don't really care about the nifty colors, What I do care about is that it works really well, its quiet and has ample wattage, it's modular and was not too expensive and most of all, it took about a week or so to get when no other PS under $250 was available on Amazon or Best Buy for months. Because of the high demand for PS's they're hard to get and prices have gone through the roof. I have built dozens of gamer PC's and Thermalake has a long history of making excellent products, especially PS, so I feel lucky to have gotten this one.
customer_reviews.author: amy schechter

customer_reviews.title: Random shut offs
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a little more than a year. During that time, randomly, my computer would turn off. Sometimes once every couple weeks, sometimes more than once a week, usually when idle, when I'm not around. Once, it happened while I was using it. Couldn't figure it out; put it on a battery backup, then a pure sine wave battery backup. Tried various other components, still happened. Replaced this one with a evga 850w - no more issues.
customer_reviews.author: DarthBob

customer_reviews.title: DOA/ Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I built my entire computer, hooked up this power supply, I bought the 850 RGB one, and guess what? I plugged it into the power and the power supply made a clicking noise, then it died. I had to buy another power supply from another manufacturer and have it sent overnight Amazon prime.... Do NOT buy this power supply, the negative reviews are for real
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible customer service. Do not buy this product. My PSU failed after a year of using it in my build. The RMA process through thermal take is a grueling process and they do zero communication during the process. I’ve been waiting 6 weeks for my replacement part and there was zero communication from them. Again. Do not buy from this maker. Their products are iffy at best and their customer service is absolutely horrible
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews but still decided to purchase the power supply. I installed this in a new PC build but it would not boot. I changed the cables and resetted the cables but still no CPU or Video card power up. I installed my old Corsair 750 watt power supply without be the moduler cable feature and the system booted right up. This CPU didn't provide enough power for my CPU or Video card. I would not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Good overall PSU
customer_reviews.text: Bought this PSU to upgrade from my old Thermaltake Smart PSU that sounded like a jet engine on high loads. This one was instantly an upgrade as there a barely audible whisper at high loads. The PSU was overall fairly easy to install as it's a modular unit. It comes with all the standard cables (and additional SATA and peripheral cables) and also included zip ties and extra screws. My only minor gripes are that the included power cable is a bit short and there's no real way to control the RGB lighting. Overall this a a really good PSU that should provide more than enough power to your system.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this PSU model
customer_reviews.text: I would avoid purchasing this PSU. I have had nothing but issues some purchasing it. My games that I would play such as Dark Souls and borderlands would consistently crash either to desktop or just completely restart my pc all together. I recently replaced it with a Seasonic PX-850 and all of my issues have disappeared. Do yourself a favor and avoid this model since it didn’t even last one year before issues arose.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply.
customer_reviews.text: So far it's perfect. Powers everything. It's silent. I have the smart fan activated so it turns off when not needed which is cool to see. The colors are nice if you have a clear case. Good value considering it limits the waste of electricity. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G.

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 2 NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: We thought this company was a good company but nope. 2 out of 2 of these power supplies never powered on. We know the rest of the system works as we are using another power supply with no issues but wanted to added a little more updated supply to the new system. Got it hooked up and nothing, no lights, no sounds, no power. Returned it and got a replacement with the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Abegail

customer_reviews.title: Quality power and generous warranty
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several thermaltake power supplies over the years. My latest one (still working) has exceeded its 5 year warranty. But I’m installing into a new build. Thought that getting another that’s now 10 YEARS should be just as reliable. Like the controllable RGB. Runs silent under 40% load. Decent price. Update (7/17/19) Had to send back my first unit. The cpu power rail was dead. Otherwise, totally fine. But, with power supplies you can’t run without even one of the power rails dead. This unit was brand new out of the box. It happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jemtec

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Oct. 21, 2019
customer_reviews.text: I received power supply Oct. 21, 2019, but it ook me a week or so to get to the computer store to have installed by repair center guys. I smelled something burning Sunday, Feb. 9, 2020. It was the power supply. The computer is now dead. I'm pretty unhappy since I thought thermaltake was a reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: It arrived much earlier than expected, but the results were very disappointing. The power supply only powered on once out of the many times tested, with the cables plugged into the right places. I even tried testing it in different outlets with a hope that it was just not enough power from the outlet. Again I was disappointed. It still doesn't work after trying to replace it, so I will definitely be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son so he could build his own PC. Has plenty of power and is RGB. He's quite pleased with its performance. I have one of the same power output, but is non RGB. I too have no complaints. We both run AMD x2700 CPUs and Vega 56 GPU cards. No problem in providing plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Read ME!
customer_reviews.text: TT is taking the PSU crown, 850w rating is continuous power, peak is 1020w, This PSU is currently powering an ETH(only) rig! with 8 GPUS (4 rx 470s, 2 R9 390s, 2 rx570s(flashed from 470). It sits at 700-750 continued power draw for over months now!
customer_reviews.author: RGlabs

customer_reviews.title: DO.NOT.PURCHASE. Read description
customer_reviews.text: This power supply is purely for aesthetics only I enjoyed it a lot before it died and ended up taking both of my hard drives with it please be aware of this before purchasing it for yourself learn from my mistakes looks aren’t what you need to worry about in a psu
customer_reviews.author: DreadfulWails

customer_reviews.title: Stable power supply with nice rgb function.
customer_reviews.text: Power supply functions 100% out of the box. RGB fan light controlled by button on the powersupply. We stress tested this and it performed well. The led lights are not distracting bright. Cables have a good length and are well made. Paired with a x470, Ryzen 5 3600x, 2060 super, multiple hard drives and rgb fans.
customer_reviews.author: FpsMafia

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great packaging, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a stickler for modular power supplies, and this PSU meets all of my expectations. Fully loaded with power options, and the modular nature makes it extremely easy to manage cables within my PC. The unit is also extremely quiet and the RGB lighting is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrive
customer_reviews.text: This PSU is dead when arrived, no package damage. I saw it has words "made in china", since the COVID19 is spreading in china, I do not want a replacement, and simply refund it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Luke

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months of using this product, strange ringing sounds started in it and my computer started to restart several times in a row ... I was afraid that this damned product would burn my computer and pulled it to hell. When I read the reviews here I was horrified ... I lost money and I can’t return the goods already. I do not advise buying this garbage if you value your computer. I was praised by this brand a lot, but I'm disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Murad

customer_reviews.title: I have ordered this Item twice!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first time it was DOA - connected everything and.... no signal, no light no nothing. I said to myself. well, it happens. So I was ordering a replacement. Guess what... DOA!!!! Twice in a row!!! How bad is that? I am done with Thermaltake.
customer_reviews.author: balint

customer_reviews.title: Good psu at a good price point
customer_reviews.text: The psu is good, and looks good. When mine was delivered, I could hear something moving around inside like a loose screw, but no issues so far. It says 12 sata power connectors should be included, mine came with one cable with a few connectors. Not enough to power what I need on my build. I contacted Thermaltake but they gave me some generic message about covid19 and shutting their parts down, so I'm s.o.l. Otherwise, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This came on time and delivery system was very good. It is exactly what I wanted, with the specs I needed. The instructions were sparse, and unclear, but as I already knew what I needed to do to install, it became a NP thing. Therrmatake is the only brand I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: relon45

customer_reviews.title: Not full RGB
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot to like about this product but it does have one small issue, it only has 3 colors to choose from and is not a great option if you’re trying to make youre whole pc match unless you want it in green blue or red. I thought it was full RGB and not only the 3 colors, my mistake I’m not returning it because it doesn’t make a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Unit was dead on arrival. I didn't have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit was dead on arrival. I didn't have a chance to set it up when I originally received it and it had been sitting in the box it came in for some time. Took it out of the box, hooked it up, turned it on, and nothing. Using a cheapo $30 power supply in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: Cydmonster

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: i took a risk getting this psu due to some of the reviews saying that this will fry your gpu or motherboard (as soon as they test it most of the time). i tested it myself and had no issues for the past MONTH i've been using it. the rgb lighting is very calm and low for those of you who aren't looking for something too crazy in terms of rgb. it's fairly quiet but noise level doesn't bother me too much, unless if it actually sounds like a jet engine. and it's power delivery is great. no issues here.
customer_reviews.author: kabir mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Great new psu
customer_reviews.text: Since we are working from home cause of the liberal shit storm Covid is causing. I thought I’d upgrade my gpu hence needed a new psu. The thermaltake psu works great. Attached the cords I needed and kept the ones out I didn’t. Turned my computer on and now have the power needed for my new gpu.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Gold and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a problem with UPS with this power supply. It's gold certified and powerful enough for most applications. If you're a builder, shop around. I did. I like Thermaltake and I like this power supply. Works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dr L.

customer_reviews.title: worst product i have received.
customer_reviews.text: I got my powersupply a while ago but i didnt use it cause i was waiting for my other parts i just now opened it and one of the gpu connections is literally burn. How can you let this happen this is really frustrating i was about to build my first sli pc but now i cant cause of this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Dead, right out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PSU because it matched the other Thermaltake RGB items on my build. I installed it in the case and flipped the switch (to check my fans) and nothing...it is dead. Amazon has been no help (took my money tho) and totally dragged their feet on shipping, so I missed the window to return it to Amazon. Their best and only advice was to deal with Thermaltake directly. It has been terrible, I contacted TT customer service weeks ago and still haven't heard a peep from them. AVOID Thermaltake products completely...it has been a total nightmare on Amazon and Thermaltake's part. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Davis

customer_reviews.title: One of the best power supplies
customer_reviews.text: You do not need more information Buy now It is one of the best power supplies that I have purchased My device is working from 2017 until now, thank God, I have not encountered any problem THX Thermaltake
customer_reviews.author: MIB

customer_reviews.title: The fan is LOUD when the unit is under load, but it provides clean power.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and provides plenty of power. However, when the fan kicks in there is horrid coil whine. I am talking jet engine loud! The RGB is bright and shiny, and it looks great in my rig. That fan noise though...
customer_reviews.author: PuterGeek2

customer_reviews.title: As a first time build this was disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I got this while i was building my first pc and when i was we were just about done and then when we try to boot it up nothing works. And we did know it was the PSU cause even the fan wouldn’t turn on. After a bit we checked the reviews and most of it was saying its not functioning. So if you do have plans to buy this I recommend you DONT but there have been good reviews but in this case don’t push your luck and find a better PSU. In my terms we are thinking to buy GAMEMAX PSU 850W this ruined my experience with ThermalTake so be careful with PSUs
customer_reviews.author: Feeb

customer_reviews.title: Really would have loved it if it worked
customer_reviews.text: DOA finally got the other parts to come in and plugged it in no RGB wasn’t a big deal connected everything and no power getting out to my board. Took it to work to test power supply and it’s not putting out anything
customer_reviews.author: Styles

customer_reviews.title: Nice Psu
customer_reviews.text: Excellent TT product ! Works as intended, quiet , cables are clearly marked . Just remember if your case has a vent at the bottom turn the psu , upside down (fan facing vent) contest to thermaltake’s recommendation of facing the fan up ...so you can enjoy the rgb lights.....smh
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Thermaltake does not offer a warranty and I have tried to reach out to them with no response. Mine still works but I thought it broke when the power cord shorted. Do no buy this unit. Get Corsair, they have better customer service. Thermaltake RMA services are non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: Rein Family

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good power supply, and talk about cool looking
customer_reviews.text: I used this on one of my gaming towers with clear glass sides. Pushed it with two high end M/board/3800 processors and 2080s cards. Never missed a beat and the lighting is fantastic. It is surprisingly quiet to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Randyman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, but the RGB lights are kind of hard to see with the design of it. The smart fan feature made me uncomfortable at first as in that mode the fan usually doesn't spin up. Other than that the only problem I have is people telling me I should have got a "better brand".
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilde

customer_reviews.title: May be last thermaltake  product I  buy
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint here is it is RGB without sync for a 130$. I can add a add-rgb to a psu..... I dont understand how they couldn't have added sync for cheap..... maybe I should just mod mine. Booo thermaltake.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M, Smith IV

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great power supply, fan is quiet, but it can be set to only turn on when needed on the back of unit. RGB is controlled via a button on the back and not via software. it can be turned off if you want as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Thermaltake PSU are awsome
customer_reviews.text: This Gold PSU works well and efficient and the RGB, makes you're case look less boring. I have no complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Candace M.

customer_reviews.title: Silent as a baby sleeping
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great powersupply it is so quiet I am so impressed. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get a PS and especially if you want to go with a LED Color Scheme its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: millersnmeva

customer_reviews.title: First one blew the breaker and let the magic smoke out
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for less than an hour now. It's blown my breaker 3 times and finally let the magic smoke out. FORTUNATELY the motherboard is still fine. Let's hope that the replacement doesn't cause any damage either and actually works. Edit: The second one is working just fine now. First one shorted when using the 4+4 connector. This one, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Great output and pretty colors
customer_reviews.text: It's a 750W PSU that does its job and does it well! The RGB is pretty nice as well! Currently have this installed in a Cougar MX330 case and it fits great, and the RGB lighting that it emits is at a pleasant level. Not too bright and not too dim. 10/10 PSU that handles my system like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: aweful
customer_reviews.text: Aweful kept restarting bad power supply I'll never buy another one again
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Did not power 3800X
customer_reviews.text: Would not power the CPU. Returned and replaced for identical model, still would not power. Verified issue by powering cpu with three power supplies from other brands. Only giving 2 stars because it is beautiful and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with a UPS
customer_reviews.text: If you use a battery-backed UPS, to alleviate issues with power fluctuations or protect against downtime, this PSU is not for you. It doesn't meet ATX standards.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with UPS
customer_reviews.text: This power supply has less than a 16 msec hold-on time that will not work with a UPS. Soon as power goes, so does the PC, instant reboot. I switched power supplies and the UPS worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: James Majczek

customer_reviews.title: Was a great product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet, easy install, packaged perfectly and had everything I needed and some. Only complaint I had was the ribbon cables are a little stiff and long for my setup but found using a little heat from a heat gun made the more pliant and easier to install where I wanted them to run. I stayed with Thermaltake because my last one was one and it performed without a problem for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Didn't work. Easily refunded but this was the first of three units I bought of different brands, and the third one worked so I know it wasn't my own fault they didn't work. Third one that finally worked was an EVGA. Amazon's products may not be so reliable but refunding them was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: More PWR
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased an RTX 3090 video card. Having this rgb 180watt pwr supply is a 100watts more than required. The head room is great for future upgrades
customer_reviews.author: Erik venta

customer_reviews.title: Silent
customer_reviews.text: Silent RGB fan Fantastic modular setup. Great looking. Plenty of cables for anything you need.
customer_reviews.author: James Burke

customer_reviews.title: decent power supply
customer_reviews.text: it's a nice power supply. like the fact it's got modularized plugs for specific power headers. a little noiser than i like. so far after 1.5mos, haven't experienced any issues or power surge from the unit. RGB is a bonus to bling out the system build.
customer_reviews.author: SpendingWayTooMuchMoneyOnAmazonDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I had two hard drives get fried since installing this power supply. I can't definitively say it was this power supply, but it certainly seems likely. Also, several of the sata ports are completely non-functional (which is why I think it was the power supply that fried the hard drives).
customer_reviews.author: michael d kelly

customer_reviews.title: Its beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Has been powering a high end gaming pc now for about 2 months no problem. Looks awesome in my chassis.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Kronenberg

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU AMAZON!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described! I built my own mini itx build using this! GAMING/STREAMING PC MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.author: dreams

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my setup and love the RGB on this unit. Works great with my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Runs like a champion
customer_reviews.text: Mine is running a Threadripper and a AIO 2060 graphics card. Runs like a champion. Haven't had it very long but with a 10 year warranty i don't think i will need to worry unless it catches the carona virus.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it for the RGB !!
customer_reviews.text: It's quite and powerful and can handle my mini itx build with Nvidia Titan X Pascal without any problem at all. I just don't like the RGB light it's very low light and not cool as the other PS I saw. just disappointed !!
customer_reviews.author: Munir S.

customer_reviews.title: great, but lights dont really work
customer_reviews.text: Lighting was ganky and didnt work well. block was amazing and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor M Biri

customer_reviews.title: Solid PSU
customer_reviews.text: Great PSU! Love the colors! Handles my rig quietly and efficiently! Running a GTX 1070ti, ryzen 5 1600x w/ strix b350 mobo. No issues and been running it for about 10 months!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mintz

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought an opened box from Amazon Wharehouse, want missing any cables, and it works perfectly. Amazingly quiet and looks great too. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Pitman

customer_reviews.title: Not Software RGB
customer_reviews.text: RGB only has a few colors that it cycles through with a button on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jayce Feldmann

customer_reviews.title: No extra 4-pin for CPU
customer_reviews.text: Everything is pretty self explanatory if you've watched any build guides at all. Only thing that keeps it from a 5 star is it not having an extra 4-pin for CPU Power. Also the PCI-e Plugs are red? Which is a bit odd to me and kinda threw off my build a little. Other than that, very good good PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Silent
customer_reviews.text: It's currently running two feet away from me with no case and it is quieter than other ambient room noise.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Colmore Adams

customer_reviews.title: Not trully 850w
customer_reviews.text: Makes vega 64 card to crash when it can be runned with a 750 on a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Angel Baez

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice power supply. Fully modular is a must. It feels pretty solid
customer_reviews.author: Julian Cosma

customer_reviews.title: They love that you can change the color of the LED ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in a computer for my kids. They love that you can change the color of the LED in the PSU. I have been using Thermaltake PSU's for about a decade and they haven't failed me. I always go for a modular PSU and Thermaltake always feels better quality than other PSU's I have used. Cable selection is great.
customer_reviews.author: Schrep

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the power supply. I love it. I saw the bad reviews and I was shaken by it. Maybe it was a bad batch and it was corrected. Sorry for the builders that got bad one. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Carnell Magruder

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU
customer_reviews.text: This PSU installed without issue and the RGB is a nice touch. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! Read the other reviews don’t be like me, installed it and it fried my motherboard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Besides aesthetics, this a nice PSU!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know what I expected for this price, but this PSU lived up to expectations and went beyond. Mostly. Because I wanted to sync RGB with rest of rig, but had to settle on either off or solid color. Expected, but still disappointing. Besides aesthetics, this a nice PSU! 3 year update: No issues so far. Changed to 5 stars as it has worked flawlessly and given me no issues so far. Seems to be delivering all the power it needs to, and stably at that.
customer_reviews.author: Kyryl

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Wish someone the wites was just a bit slimmer but over all it runs my new rig like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Fossitt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing PSU that works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Amazing PSU that works just as advertised, supplies enough wattage for mild overclocks. The only issue would be the RGB, it's very hard to notice considering if you have the fan facing downwards, the LEDs aren't that bright, so don't expect to see the glow unless you have your case above you, or the fan portion visible.
customer_reviews.author: Rondel Nabua

customer_reviews.title: Great Option
customer_reviews.text: This product works excellent. I love how it's easy to install and has a good amount of powering options.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: it works. so far.
customer_reviews.text: I like thermaltake products this one is par for course. solid build. best thing about this PS is the fan can be turned off. all though its not that loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I think this thing is pretty silent and the RGB works great. Actually I do have the fan passive switch on so it is silent.
customer_reviews.author: T. Luggiero

customer_reviews.title: not continuous power draw
customer_reviews.text: fps drop during game play at random time while playing overwatch im at a comfortable 170 and will drop to 70 i do have youtube playing in the back ground asides from that its a rgb gimmick psu so its good, but not what im looking for
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Nooope
customer_reviews.text: Was great for the first 6 months. Now will not power on. May have fried gpu.... plugged my old psu in and monitors don't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Low noise and hardly any heat. What else is there to say, but this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: dead on arrival for the third time over a month Later!@
customer_reviews.text: bought the first no name brand may 7th, then bought another that was also different name more money. this one I thought I would be great with! no go! dead on arrival!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Iovinelli

customer_reviews.title: Quality PSU
customer_reviews.text: The LED Ring fan is very pretty. 850 gold. Does the job very well. In a quite environment I can hear it over any other component. However I'm using a mesh airflow focused case. All in All, very satisfied with this PSU
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Barnes

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Toughpower Grand RGB 850W 80+ Gold Smart Zero 256-Color RGB Fan Fully Modular Power Supply 10 Yr Warranty PS-TPG-0850FPCGUS-R
product_meta.description: Size:Gold| Style:850W| Pattern Name:RGB FanThermaltake, as the pioneer who incorporates RGB lights into PSU, has launched the Thermaltake Toughpower Grand RGB Gold Series, coming with a pre-installed, patented 256 Colors Riing 14 RGB fan with 5 lighting modes to choose from and built-in memory. Featuring capacities ranging from 650W to 850W and 80 PLUS Gold certification, Toughpower Grand RGB Series adopts the highest quality components and fully modular design that always accommodate any mainstream build under any circumstances. Received FunkKit's "Recommended" award"Toughpower Grand RGB 850W is a great PSU. " - FunkyKit"The Power Supply holds up very well under load and looks good while doing so with the Riing RGB Fan. " - FunkyKit8. 8/10 score on JonnyGURU"I think Thermaltake struck a pretty good balance here, I really do. " - JonnyGURU"Overall I am rather impressed with the Toughpower Grand RGB, the modular design is perfect at this price point and the RGB feature is great for those building a system using RGB LEDs. " - Hardware AsylumRecieved HardOCP's "Editor's Choice Silver" Award"We start off with generally very good build quality and follow this up with good support and general load testing results that make this unit more than competitive. " – HardOCPType: ATX 12V v2. 4 and EPS v2. 92Max. Output Capacity: 850WPeak Output Capacity: 1020WDimension (W / H / D): 150mm (W) x 86mm (H) x 160mm (D)PFC (Power Factor Correction): Active PFCPower Good Signal: 100-500 msecInput Current: 12AInput Frequency Range: 50Hz - 60HzInput Voltage: 100V – 240V~Operating Temperature: 0°C to + 50°COperating Humidity: 20% to 90%, non-condensingStorage Temperature: -40°C to + 70°CStorage Humidity: 20% to 95%, non-condensingCooling System: 14cm hydraulic bearing fanEfficiency: Meet 80 PLUS Gold at 115Vac input. MTBF: 120, 000 hrs minimumSafety Approval: CE/cTUVus/TÜV SÜD/FCC/CCC/BSMI/EACProtection: (UVP) Under Voltage Protection(OVP) Over Voltage Protection(OCP) Over Current Protection (SCP) Short Circuit Protection(OPP) Over Power Protection(OTP) Over Temperature Protection
feature_bullets: ONE BUTTON RGB CONTROL : RGB Lighting Button at the back of PSU controls 5 different lighting modes, RGB Cycle, Red, Green, Blue, White, and LED Off

80 PLUS Gold and KABY LAKE READY : Deliver up to 90percentage efficiency, Tough power RGB Gold Series has been optimized to work with Intel’s latest, Seventh generation Kaby Lake processors to achieve maximum energy saving
ULTRA QUIET SMART ZERO FAN : Fan works only when PSU working load is over 20 percentage. A switch at the back of the PSU can be turned off to have the fan spun constantly
JAPANESE CAPACITORS :100 percentage high quality 105°C (221°F) Japanese capacitors offer the highest stability, durability, and reliability
Less than 30 mV LOW RIPPLE NOISE : Low ripple from 0 percentage to 100 percentage load keeps performance critical components, such as high end graphic card, operating reliably longer

INDUSTRIAL PROTECTIONS : (UVP) Under Voltage Protection, (OVP) Over Voltage Protection, (SCP) Short Circuit Protection, (OPP) Over Power Protection, (OTP) Over Temperature Protection, and (OCP) Over Current Protection
Main Power (24 Pin) x 1, ATX 12V (4+4 Pin) x 1, SATA (5 Pin) x 12, PCI E (6+2 Pin) x 6, Peripheral x 4, FDD Adapter x 1
RGB LED FAN 256 colors Riing RGB 140 millimeter Hydraulic Bearing fan with low noise design. Fan blades are optimized to enhance static pressure for an impressive cooling performance
SINGLE +12V RAIL DESIG Powerful 12V+ single rail supports today’s CPU, GPU demands and DC to DC design for stable, reliable power
